definition: the text of an annotated book/an unannotated edition of a book/intagliated characters (on a seal)

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: Without notes, I can hardly understand ancient Chinese prose.
sentences.chinese: 注解，我根本看不懂这些白文。

sentences.english: In a fight to save in Bai Yang and lentils.
sentences.chinese: 在一次打架斗殴中杨林为了救白文得罪了沈庆和扁豆。

sentences.english: There are very close relations between the writing symbol system of the old Bai scrip and Chinese Variant characters.
sentences.chinese: 方块白文的书写符号系统与汉字俗字有很密切的关系。

sentences.english: Yang Fu was a noted Bai scholar of Dali, who once wrote Shanhua Stele in Bai language.
sentences.chinese: 杨黼是大理著名的白族学者，著有白文《山花碑》。

definition: interpreting words/to explain the meaning of words in classic texts/to decipher an old script
recreative seal, bearing not the owner's name but a well-known verse or such, and used for artistic purposes on paintings etc
to write the title of a book on a label
short comment or critical appraisal added at the end of a text, on a painting etc
seal (of office)/seal script (a calligraphic style)/the small seal 小篆 and great seal 大篆/writing in seal script
seal script as unified by the Qin dynasty/the small seal 小篆 and great seal 大篆
